title: orch complete closes issues without verifying work was done
description:
## Problem

`orch complete` closed beads issues even when:
1. No WORKSPACE.md was created (agent never tracked work)
2. No commits were made
3. Actual implementation work was never done

## Evidence

In price-watch project (2025-12-04):
- pw-5mi, pw-v92, pw-cf8 all closed via `orch complete`
- All 3 workspaces had only SPAWN_CONTEXT.md (no WORKSPACE.md)
- Zero commits related to the work
- Actual configs still use base parts (work never done)

## Expected Behavior

`orch complete` should fail or warn if:
1. WORKSPACE.md doesn't exist (agent never started tracking)
2. No commits since spawn time
3. Phase is not 'Complete' in WORKSPACE.md

## Current Behavior

`orch complete` closes the beads issue based solely on agent-id existing in registry, without verifying deliverables.

## Impact

Work gets lost - issues appear done but aren't. Discovered during post-session audit when 5 configs still needed updates despite 3 'completed' issues.

title: Agents complete work but skip completion protocol (no WORKSPACE.md, no Phase: Complete)
description:
## Problem
Agents finish their actual work (commits, tests pass) but don't follow completion protocol:
- ‚ùå Never create WORKSPACE.md
- ‚ùå Never mark Phase: Complete
- ‚ùå Sit idle at prompt instead of exiting

This leaves agents in limbo - work is done but orch system can't detect completion properly.

## Example
feat-simplify-coll-run-04dec:
- ‚úÖ Committed work (607a142 - simplified 3 collection run configs)
- ‚úÖ Tests passed
- ‚ùå No WORKSPACE.md created
- ‚ùå No Phase: Complete
- ‚ùå Still at prompt (12% context left)

## Root Cause Candidates
1. Skill instructions not prominent enough about workspace/phase requirements
2. Agent context exhaustion before reaching completion steps
3. Missing enforcement in spawn context
4. Agent confused about when to create WORKSPACE.md vs just work

## Impact
- Manual intervention required to detect and clean up
- orch complete can't auto-verify
- Work gets stuck in limbo state

title: Document browser-use best practices to avoid context bloat
description:
browser_get_state with include_screenshot or on element-heavy pages can return 15-25k tokens, obliterating context windows.

Key practices to document:
- Never use include_screenshot: true unless absolutely necessary
- Use browser_extract_content(query) for targeted data extraction
- Get state once, remember element indices, don't re-poll
- Only re-fetch state after navigation or structural page changes

Create knowledge file: .orch/knowledge/browser-use-best-practices.md

title: Prevent workers from running bd close directly
description:
Workers are closing beads issues directly via 'bd close' which bypasses orch complete verification (Phase: Complete check, workspace verification, etc).

## Problem
- Workers running 'bd close' bypasses verification
- Orchestrator loses visibility
- Agent registry may still show agent as active while issue is closed

## Solution (two-pronged)
1. **Guidance fix**: Update spawn_prompt.py to explicitly warn workers never to run 'bd close'
2. **Enforcement fix**: Add PreToolUse Claude hook that blocks 'bd close' when CLAUDE_CONTEXT=worker

## Implementation notes
- spawn_prompt.py already has partial edit (line ~528) - complete or integrate properly
- Hook should go in ~/.orch/hooks/ or ~/.claude/hooks/
- Register hook in ~/.claude/settings.json PreToolUse section
- Hook returns error message guiding worker to use 'bd comment' instead

title: Fix false positive: WORKSPACE.md missing violation on just-spawned agents
description:
## Problem
`orch check` reports a CRITICAL violation 'WORKSPACE.md file missing' immediately after spawning an agent, before the agent has had a chance to create its workspace file.

## Expected
- Either don't check for WORKSPACE.md until agent has been running for some threshold (e.g., 30 seconds)
- Or downgrade from CRITICAL to INFO for newly-spawned agents
- Or only check once agent phase is known

## Reproduction
1. `orch spawn feature-impl "any task"`
2. Immediately run `orch check <agent-id>`
3. See CRITICAL violation for missing WORKSPACE.md

## Location
Likely in orch-cli pattern checking logic
